required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: What Makes People Better at Retrieving Difficult Words?
clinical_study.official_title: What Makes People Better at Retrieving Difficult Words?

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to learn more about how various personal and situational characteristics are related to the ability to produce words in response to definitions. Participants will watch a video, then see definitions and try to come up with a word that fits each one. Participants will also complete some surveys and other measures. Collected data will give researchers a better understanding of how individuals' personality and cognitive traits and setting in which word retrieval occurs relate to the ability to produce individual words.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is being conducted to learn more about how various personal and situational characteristics are related to the ability to produce words in response to definitions. Adult participants ages 18-30 and 65-80 will participate in videoconference calls during which a video is shown and definitions are presented. Participants will try to come up with a word that fits each definition, and then complete some surveys, including some about anxiety, mindfulness, attention, vocabulary, and demographics. Participation will take approximately 1.25 hours. Collected data will be de-identified, and the aggregate data will give researchers a better understanding of how individuals' personality and cognitive traits and setting in which word retrieval occurs relate to peoples' ability to produce individual words.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomly assigned to one of two behavioral intervention conditions before performing a word retrieval task
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants in each condition do not know what other participants are doing, nor that there is another condition.

primary_outcome.description: Correct responses and word retrieval failures will be measured on a task created for this purpose. Specifically, participants will try to provide words that best fit definitions, indicating when a word gets stuck on the "tip of their tongue."

arm_group.description: Participants watch a 10 minute mindful breathing video
Participants watch a 10 minute control video

intervention.description: Participants watch a 10 minute mindful breathing video
Participants watch a 10 minute control video

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- fluent speakers of English ages 18-30 or ages 65-80

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified participant data may be posted on a website for open access to other researchers, if the publication outlet requires it, but it is not currently planned.
